isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - GLOW PLUG CONTROL - GLOW PLUG SYSTEM EXTENDED SYSTEM DESCRIPTION

svcproc.title: GLOW PLUG SYSTEM EXTENDED SYSTEM DESCRIPTION

svcsubproc.title: Function
svcsubproc.para: The Navistar engine control system includes a Glow Plug Control System that controls the current flow to the glow plugs. Glow plug relay "ON" time is controlled by the ECM and is a function of Engine Coolant Temperature, Barometric Pressure, and Battery Voltage. Glow plug "ON" time varies between 10-120 seconds. Glow plugs are self limiting glow plugs and do not require to be cycled on and off. The glow plug relay will cycle on and off repeatedly, if battery voltage is greater than 13.0 volts.

svcsubproc.title: Operation
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to circuit diagram ( Figure 3.63
) for the following discussion.

Glow Plug System operation "ON" time is dependent upon engine coolant temperature, barometric pressure and battery voltage. The ECM turns on the glow plug relay by supplying power through the engine connector pin #38 to circuit 97CH. The coil of the glow plug relay is grounded through circuit 97GR through engine connector pin #28. Power is supplied to the switch side of the glow plug relay from the starter motor. When the relay coil is energized, power is supplied to the glow plugs which are grounded through the cylinder head.
The "Wait To Start Lamp" is controlled through chassis connector pin #53. The lamp is illuminated when the ECM grounds circuit 18G through pin #53.
The Glow Plug Wait Lamp is also turned on by the ECM when the glow plug relay is enabled.

note.para: Wait light on time is independent from glow plug relay on time and is usually much shorter in duration.

svcsubproc.title: ECM DIAGNOSTICS
svcsubproc.para: The ECM does not continuously monitor the glow plug control circuitry. An open or shorted to ground glow plug control relay on the control side (coil) circuit can be detected by an on demand output circuit check performed during the engine off test.

Fault codes can be retrieved using the electronic service tool or the STI Self Test Input Diagnostic Switch located on the vehicle dashboard. If the ignition key is shutoff, the code will be stored as an active code.

Code 251 is set only during the Engine Off Standard Output Circuit check. This indicates that the ECM has performed an output circuit test, measured the voltage drop across the glow plug relay circuit and determined it is above or below specification. If the fault is present, the glow plug relay is not operating and the glow plugs are not enabled.
Possible Causes: Open feed circuit, open glow plug relay coil, an open or shorted GPC signal circuit.

para.emph: GLOW PLUG LAMP: OCC SELF TEST FAILED

svcsubproc.para: Code 252 is set only during the Engine Off Standard Output Circuit check. This indicates that the ECM has performed an output circuit test, measured the voltage drop across the glow plug Wait Lamp circuit and determined it is above or below specification.
Possible Causes: Glow plug Wait Lamp burned out, open or shorted glow plug Wait Lamp circuit.
